extendedInfo.description: BETA VERSIONUsing CamRanger hardware (purchased separately from CamRanger.com) wirelessly control your Nikon or Canon DLSR camera! (Also compatible with iOS, Mac and PC)  The CamRanger is a wireless tethering system that can also act as a wireless file transmitter. Note that this is beta software and while it is quite functional there are some bugs to be fixed and functionality to be added.The first of its kind, no other computers or Internet needed! Just connect your camera to the CamRanger and then control wirelessly from your Android device, or optionally take photos from the camera with the photos transmitted to the Android device.  Loaded with features: Live View View and set parameters (ISO, Aperture, Shutter Speed, White Balance, Focus Mode, Capture Mode, etc) Live View touch focusing and focus adjustments Remote Capture View 100% resolution images with meta data including histogram (supports JPG and Canon RAW) Import all image formats (including RAW) to iOS Photo Library Movie Recording and focusing Focus Stacking Intervalometer (Time Lapse) Bulb Mode Advanced Bracketing/HDR Download images to Android deviceClient mode (take pictures from camera and client views on Android device)Officially Supported Cameras: Canon:  Xsi, T1i, T2i, T3i, T4i, 40D, 50D, 60D, 6D, 5D Mark II, 5D Mark III, 1DS Mark III, 1D Mark IV, 1DxNikon: D5000, D5100, D5200, D90, D7000, D7100, D300, D300S, D700, D600, D800, D800E, D3, D3s, D3x, D4Not all cameras support all features, and supporting additional cameras is coming soon. See www.CamRanger.com for more detailed information.

reviews.title: Getting warmer...
reviews.comment: The initial beta was great. Next few updates resulted in an unusable app.  Latest version is finally ALMOST as good as v 0.1
reviews.author: Mo Bius

reviews.title: Doesn\'t control D800 Video
reviews.comment: This app works great on my iPad. On my android devices though, the app connects to the D800, but I cannot adjust the shutter,aperture or iso in video mode. I\'ve contacted the company with no response.
reviews.author: Christopher Odd

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Works best with my canon 5D III on Ipad and I really wish to get it work the same way on android devices.. I gave you all support i can.. Really wonderful device and i hope you update the software always to be smoother and more functionality :)

reviews.title: Needs work
reviews.comment: Latest beta still hasn\'t the same functionality as the iOS version.  You can\'t do long exposure timelapse so absolutely no good for astrophotography. Come on, please get it sorted.
reviews.author: Neil Pilkington

reviews.title: Works great so far
reviews.comment: I\'ve only had the chance to play with this a bit on my galaxy s2 and so far I haven\'t had any problems with the app itself (the s2 has its own limitations -nothing to do with the app). Can\'t wait to get a real tablet!
reviews.author: Matthew Chase

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.comment: Works great!! Canon 6D and Moto tablet.
reviews.author: Roland Labana

reviews.title: Dont recommend
reviews.comment: Extremely cheap looking, unreliable, unstable. Very early in development and has a very long way to go to be worth $299. Gave me a lot of issues with Samsung Galaxy Note and Canon 5D mk ii. Shipping back for a refund.
reviews.author: TJ Manou

reviews.comment: Great having my Droid for camera control.
reviews.author: Erik Benner

reviews.comment: Integrates well with the Camranger. All functions work well.
reviews.author: Ed B
